pr_title: CB-8778 validate paywall access before starting the upgrade process

timeline.message:
CB-8778 validate paywall access before starting the upgrade process
For runtime upgrade, we have to download the CM and CDP builds from paywall
(archive.cloudera.com/p/). The CM license that is configured uniquely for each
CDP account can be used to authenticate. However, it can happen that customers
do not have an updated license that can be used. In this case, it would be a
mistake to even start the upgrade process. Instead, whenever an upgrade is
requested we'll validate if we can use the configured license to access the paywall.
If it's not valid we will reject the request. Once they update the license in UMS
we will also update the license as part of the upgrade process to make sure
we can download everything. We're also NOT checking the validity of the license
when we're searching for upgrade candidates. This is because this operation happens
very frequently (each time you open up the Datalake details page on the UI). Due to
this we will show a message on the UI that upgrades are available, but when they
try to trigger it we will reject the request.
